meta.name: description
meta.content: Welcome to the new Columbus.gov! We are thrilled to present a revamped digital experience that caters to the needs of all users. Discover a website that offers improved access to valuable information and services. Whether you are a resident, business owner, or visitor, we are committed to providing a better online platform to meet your needs. Explore the updated Columbus.gov and embrace a more user-friendly and efficient online experience.

div.h3: Columbus Provides Notification and Extends Credit Monitoring

div.p: Working with federal authorities and cybersecurity experts, the City of Columbus continues its investigation and response to a July cybersecurity incident.

div.p: The new and improved Columbus.gov features streamlined, user-friendly navigation to help you find what you need more quickly and easily. Still can't find what youre looking for? Use the enhanced search function at the top of every page.

a.title: Columbus Provides Notification, Extends Credit Monitoring
a.h2: Columbus Provides Notification, Extends Credit Monitoring
a.p: Taking action to protect the community from the recent cyber attack on the citys IT infrastructure, the City of Columbus today announced it will offer free Experian credit monitoring to all residents and impacted individuals.

a.title: Mayor Ginther Selects Kym Douglas to Lead Department of Neighborhoods
a.h2: Mayor Ginther Selects Kym Douglas to Lead Department of Neighborhoods
a.p: Mayor Andrew J. Ginther announced that Kym Douglas will serve as the next director of the citys Department of Neighborhoods.

a.title: City of Columbus Offers Credit Monitoring for All Employees
a.h2: City of Columbus Offers Credit Monitoring for All Employees
a.p: Working with federal authorities and cybersecurity experts, the City of Columbus continues its investigation and response to a July cybersecurity incident.

a.title: Columbus Thwarted Ransomware Encryption of its IT Infrastructure
a.h2: Columbus Thwarted Ransomware Encryption of its IT Infrastructure
a.p: The City of Columbus continuing investigation of a July 18 cybersecurity incident has found that a foreign cyber threat actor attempted to disrupt the citys IT infrastructure, in a possible effort to deploy ransomware and solicit a ransom payment from the city.

div.p: The City of Columbus now has nine districts, nine councilmembers and a hybrid at-large system. Click below to view the map and find your district.

City Hall
